qas.question: What does the term "Count Noun" mean?
What cultural traits fall under the term count noun?

answers.text: customs, traditions and values of a society or community

qas.question: What falls within the term "cultural anthropology"?

answers.text: the ideology and analytical stance of cultural relativism

qas.question: What can never be used as a count noun?
What is a concept that values an angry coexistence and mutual disrespect between different cultures inhabiting the same territory?
What term is no longer used to describe specific practices within a subgroup of a society?
What perspective holds that cultures can be easily ranked and evaluated?

context: When used as a count noun <b3_0>"<a0_0>a culture<a0_0/>"<b3_0/>, is the set of <a1_0>customs, traditions and values of a society or community<a1_0/>, such as an ethnic group or nation. In this sense, <b4_0>multiculturalism<b4_0/> is a concept that values the peaceful coexistence and mutual respect between different cultures inhabiting the same territory. Sometimes "<b5_0>culture<b5_0/>" is also used to describe specific practices within a subgroup of a society, a subculture (e.g. "bro culture"), or a counter culture. Within cultural anthropology, <a2_0>the ideology and analytical stance of <b6_0>cultural relativism<b6_0/><a2_0/> holds that cultures cannot easily be objectively ranked or evaluated because any evaluation is necessarily situated within the value system of a given culture.
